metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11319 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: Syntastic (aka vim-syntastic) through 3.9.0 does not properly handle searches for configuration files (it searches the current directory up to potentially the root). This improper handling might be exploited for arbitrary code execution via a malicious gcc plugin, if an attacker has write access to a directory that is a parent of the base directory of the project being checked. NOTE: exploitation is more difficult after 3.8.0 because filename prediction may be needed.

criterions.comment: vim-syntastic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
